content:
Diagnosis
	1. Prostate cancer - bilateral ductal adenocarcinoma T3aN0M0
	Date of diagnosis
	January 2024

	Treatment aim
	Curative

	Summary of completed treatment and relevant dates

	Surgery
	Not indicated

	Radiotherapy
	Not yet commenced

	Chemotherapy
	Not indicated

	Clinical studies
	PROTECT-2 trial of novel androgen receptor inhibitor XJ-573
	Randomised 15 Feb 2024
	Commenced treatment 01 Mar 2024

	Current disease status
	Stable disease on trial treatment

	Current issues
	Grade 1 fatigue

	Summary of consultation
	This 62-year-old gentleman is participating in the PROTECT-2 trial and attended for his week 8 assessment. His PSA has decreased from 23.4 at baseline to 4.2, representing an excellent biochemical response. He reports mild fatigue but maintains his usual activities. No other toxicities noted. Trial-mandated blood tests show stable liver function and testosterone remains adequately suppressed at <0.3nmol/L.

On examination today, digital rectal examination shows reduction in prostatic induration compared to baseline. No new concerning features. Performance status remains 0.

	Further investigations
	Trial-mandated MRI prostate scheduled for 15 May 2024

	Medication prescribed
	Trial medication (XJ-573 vs placebo) continuing at full dose

	Follow up
	Next trial assessment in 4 weeks with PSA, testosterone, and liver function

	Required GP actions
	Please monitor blood pressure weekly as per trial protocol

cancer_timeline.value: Randomised to PROTECT-2 trial of XJ-573 vs placebo

patient_facts.value: Digital rectal examination shows reduction in prostatic induration
Stable liver function, testosterone adequately suppressed <0.3nmol/L

status_updates.value: Newly diagnosed bilateral prostate cancer showing good biochemical response to trial medication with minimal toxicity
PSA reduction from 23.4 to 4.2 with reduction in prostatic induration
Continuing trial medication at full dose
Trial-mandated MRI prostate scheduled for 15 May 2024
Next trial assessment in 4 weeks with PSA, testosterone, and liver function
